meanings.definition: Covered with or resembling oar-like projections.
meanings.sent1: The boat had an oary appearance with its long, flat sides.
meanings.sent2: The oary design of the paddle made it easy to row the boat.
meanings.sent3: The oary pattern on the fabric made the shirt look unique.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, wet from the rain, clung to her head in an oary fashion.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the waves with an oary texture that seemed to move.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an oar.
meanings.sent1: The sailor's oary skills helped him navigate the rough waters.
meanings.sent2: She admired the oary craftsmanship of the wooden oar.
meanings.sent3: The chef used an oary motion to stir the soup in the pot.
meanings.sent4: His voice had an oary quality that resonated through the room.
meanings.sent5: The oary sound of the paddle cutting through the water was soothing.

meanings.definition: Resembling an oar in shape or function.
meanings.sent1: The oary handle of the tool made it easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The boat had an oary silhouette against the setting sun.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches swayed in an oary motion in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had an oary flow as she walked down the street.
meanings.sent5: The oary shape of the cloud reminded him of a giant paddle.
